name: Analytical Balance
usage: Precise weighing of pharmaceutical compounds and reagents.

name: Fume Hood
usage: Ventilated enclosure to safely handle hazardous fumes and vapors.

name: Micro-Pipette
usage: Accurate measurement and transfer of small liquid volumes.

name: Centrifuge
usage: Separation of fluids

name: HPLC System
usage: High-Performance Liquid Chromatography for separating drug components.

name: Rotary Evaporator
usage: Gentle removal of solvents from samples by evaporation.

name: Magnetic Stirrer
usage: Mixing chemical solutions using a rotating magnetic field.

name: Autoclave
usage: Sterilizing laboratory glassware and equipment using high-pressure steam.

name: Spectrophotometer
usage: Measuring how much a chemical substance absorbs light.

name: pH Meter
usage: Measuring the acidity or alkalinity of drug formulations.

name: Mass Spectrometer
usage: Identifying the chemical constitution of drug molecules.

name: Microscope
usage: Visual inspection of crystalline structures or biological samples.

name: Incubator
usage: Maintaining optimal temperature/humidity for cell cultures.

name: Vortex Mixer
usage: Rapid mixing of small vials of liquid.

name: Freeze Dryer
usage: Dehydration of heat-sensitive drugs (Lyophilization)..

name: pXRD Instrument
usage: Characterization of crystalline materials in drug compounds.

name: Spectrofluorometer
usage: Measuring fluorescence properties of drug molecules.

name: Thermocycler
usage: Amplification of DNA sequences for genetic analysis.

name: Gel Electrophoresis System
usage: Separation of DNA/RNA fragments by size.

name: Water Bath
usage: Maintaining samples at a constant temperature.

name: Dissolution Tester
usage: Determining the rate at which tablets dissolve in solution.

name: Disintegration Tester
usage: Measuring the time required for tablets to break down into particles.

name: Friability Tester
usage: Assessing the durability of tablets against mechanical shock and abrasion.

name: Tablet Hardness Tester
usage: Measuring the structural integrity and breaking point of tablets.

name: Karl Fischer Titrator
usage: Precise determination of trace water content in samples.

name: Melting Point Apparatus
usage: Determining the melting point of a solid to assess purity.

name: Sonicator
usage: Using ultrasonic energy to dissolve difficult samples or clean equipment.

name: Gas Chromatograph
usage: Separating and analyzing volatile compounds in a mixture.

name: Refractometer
usage: Measuring the refractive index to identify or check purity of liquids.

name: Viscometer
usage: Measuring the viscosity and flow properties of liquid drug formulations.

name: Desiccator
usage: Preserving moisture-sensitive chemicals or samples in a dry environment.

name: Hot Plate
usage: Heating samples in beakers or flasks with adjustable temperature.

name: PCR Machine
usage: Amplifying specific DNA segments via temperature cycling.

name: Biosafety Cabinet
usage: Providing a sterile environment for handling cell cultures or hazardous agents.

name: FTIR Spectrometer
usage: Identifying chemical bonds and molecular structure using infrared absorption.

name: Vacuum Oven
usage: Drying heat-sensitive materials effectively under reduced pressure.
